Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and very faint traces of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394830) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394830)
